children.help: Select this option to enable WPS registrar support in softAP mode.
children.name: ESP_WIFI_WPS_SOFTAP_REGISTRAR
children.title: Add WPS Registrar support in SoftAP mode

children.help: Enable Wi-Fi DL MU-MIMO and DL OFDMA reception statistics. Will use 10932 bytes memory.
children.name: ESP_WIFI_ENABLE_WIFI_RX_MU_STATS
children.title: Enable Wi-Fi DL MU-MIMO and DL OFDMA reception statistics

children.help:
Enable Wi-Fi reception statistics. Total support 2 access category. Each access category
will use 190 bytes memory.
children.name: ESP_WIFI_ENABLE_WIFI_RX_STATS
children.title: Enable Wi-Fi reception statistics

children.help:
Select this option to enable validate each WPS attribute
rigorously. Disabling this add the workaorunds with various APs.
Enabling this may cause inter operability issues with some APs.
children.name: ESP_WIFI_WPS_STRICT
children.title: Strictly validate all WPS attributes

children.help:
Select this option to get passphrase during WPS configuration.
This option fakes the virtual display capabilites to get the
configuration in passphrase mode.
Not recommanded to be used since WPS credentials should not
be shared to other devices, making it in readable format increases
that risk, also passphrase requires pbkdf2 to convert in psk.
children.name: ESP_WIFI_WPS_PASSPHRASE
children.title: Get WPA2 passphrase in WPS config

children.help:
Select this option to print logging information from WPA supplicant,
this includes handshake information and key hex dumps depending
on the project logging level.

Enabling this could increase the build size ~60kb
depending on the project logging level.
children.name: ESP_WIFI_DEBUG_PRINT
children.title: Print debug messages from WPA Supplicant

children.help: Select this to enable unity test for DPP.
children.name: ESP_WIFI_TESTING_OPTIONS
children.title: Add DPP testing code

children.help:
Select place to store core dump: flash, uart or none (to disable core dumps generation).

Core dumps to Flash are not available if PSRAM is used for task stacks.

If core dump is configured to be stored in flash and custom partition table is used add
corresponding entry to your CSV. For examples, please see predefined partition table CSV descriptions
in the components/partition_table directory.
children.name: ESP_COREDUMP_TO_FLASH_OR_UART
children.title: Data destination

children.help: Select the data format for core dump.
children.name: ESP_COREDUMP_DATA_FORMAT
children.title: Core dump data format

children.help: Select the integrity check for the core dump.
children.name: ESP_COREDUMP_CHECKSUM
children.title: Core dump data integrity check

children.help:
When enabled, if any data are found on the flash core dump partition,
they will be checked by calculating their checksum.
children.name: ESP_COREDUMP_CHECK_BOOT
children.title: Check core dump data integrity on boot

children.help: Enables/disable core dump module.
children.name: ESP_COREDUMP_ENABLE

children.help:
Enable/disable coredump logs. Logs strings from espcoredump component are
placed in DRAM. Disabling these helps to save ~5KB of internal memory.
children.name: ESP_COREDUMP_LOGS
children.title: Enable coredump logs for debugging

children.help: Maximum number of tasks snapshots in core dump.
children.name: ESP_COREDUMP_MAX_TASKS_NUM
children.title: Maximum number of tasks

children.help:
Config delay (in ms) before printing core dump to UART.
Delay can be interrupted by pressing Enter key.
children.name: ESP_COREDUMP_UART_DELAY
children.title: Delay before print to UART

children.help: Force the use of a custom DRAM stack for coredump when Task stacks can be in PSRAM.
children.name: ESP_COREDUMP_USE_STACK_SIZE

children.help:
Size of the memory to be reserved for core dump stack. If 0 core dump process will run on
the stack of crashed task/ISR, otherwise special stack will be allocated.
To ensure that core dump itself will not overflow task/ISR stack set this to the value above 800.
NOTE: It eats DRAM.
children.name: ESP_COREDUMP_STACK_SIZE
children.title: Reserved stack size

children.help:
Size of the buffer that would be reserved for extracting backtrace info summary.
This buffer will contain the stack dump of the crashed task. This dump is useful in generating backtrace
children.name: ESP_COREDUMP_SUMMARY_STACKDUMP_SIZE
children.title: Size of the stack dump buffer

children.name: ESP_COREDUMP_DECODE
children.title: Handling of UART core dumps in IDF Monitor

children.help: Number of volumes (logical drives) to use.
children.name: FATFS_VOLUME_COUNT
children.title: Number of volumes

children.help:
Support long filenames in FAT. Long filename data increases
memory usage. FATFS can be configured to store the buffer for
long filename data in stack or heap.
children.name: FATFS_LONG_FILENAMES
children.title: Long filename support

children.help: Specify the size of the sector in bytes for FATFS partition generator.
children.name: FATFS_SECTOR_SIZE
children.title: Sector size

children.help:
OEM code page used for file name encodings.

If "Dynamic" is selected, code page can be chosen at runtime using
f_setcp function. Note that choosing this option will increase
application size by ~480kB.
children.name: FATFS_CHOOSE_CODEPAGE
children.title: OEM Code Page

children.help: Maximum long filename length. Can be reduced to save RAM.
children.name: FATFS_MAX_LFN
children.title: Max long filename length

children.help:
Choose encoding for character and string arguments/returns when using
FATFS APIs. The encoding of arguments will usually depend on text
editor settings.
children.name: FATFS_API_ENCODING
children.title: API character encoding

children.help:
This option sets the FATFS configuration value _FS_LOCK.
The option _FS_LOCK switches file lock function to control duplicated file open
and illegal operation to open objects.

* 0: Disable file lock function. To avoid volume corruption, application
should avoid illegal open, remove and rename to the open objects.

* >0: Enable file lock function. The value defines how many files/sub-directories
can be opened simultaneously under file lock control.

Note that the file lock control is independent of re-entrancy.
children.name: FATFS_FS_LOCK
children.title: Number of simultaneously open files protected by lock function

children.help:
This option sets FATFS configuration value _FS_TIMEOUT, scaled to milliseconds.
Sets the number of milliseconds FATFS will wait to acquire a mutex when
operating on an open file. For example, if one task is performing a lenghty
operation, another task will wait for the first task to release the lock,
and time out after amount of time set by this option.
children.name: FATFS_TIMEOUT_MS
children.title: Timeout for acquiring a file lock, ms

children.help:
This option affects FATFS configuration value _FS_TINY.

If this option is set, _FS_TINY is 0, and each open file has its own cache,
size of the cache is equal to the _MAX_SS variable (512 or 4096 bytes).
This option uses more RAM if more than 1 file is open, but needs less reads
and writes to the storage for some operations.

If this option is not set, _FS_TINY is 1, and single cache is used for
all open files, size is also equal to _MAX_SS variable. This reduces the
amount of heap used when multiple files are open, but increases the number
of read and write operations which FATFS needs to make.
children.name: FATFS_PER_FILE_CACHE
children.title: Use separate cache for each file

children.help:
When the option is enabled, internal buffers used by FATFS will be allocated
from external RAM. If the allocation from external RAM fails, the buffer will
be allocated from the internal RAM.
Disable this option if optimizing for performance. Enable this option if
optimizing for internal memory size.
children.name: FATFS_ALLOC_PREFER_EXTRAM
children.title: Perfer external RAM when allocating FATFS buffers

children.help:
If fast seek algorithm is enabled, this defines the size of
CLMT buffer used by this algorithm in 32-bit word units.
This value should be chosen based on prior knowledge of
maximum elements of each file entry would store.
children.name: FATFS_FAST_SEEK_BUFFER_SIZE
children.title: Fast seek CLMT buffer size

children.help:
The fast seek feature enables fast backward/long seek operations without
FAT access by using an in-memory CLMT (cluster link map table).
Please note, fast-seek is only allowed for read-mode files, if a
file is opened in write-mode, the seek mechanism will automatically fallback
to the default implementation.
children.name: FATFS_USE_FASTSEEK
children.title: Enable fast seek algorithm when using lseek function through VFS FAT

children.help:
If set to 0, the 'newlib' library's default size (BLKSIZ) is used (128 B).
If set to a non-zero value, the value is used as the block size.
Default file buffer size is set to this value
and the buffer is allocated when first attempt of reading/writing to a file is made.
Increasing this value improves fread() speed, however the heap usage is increased as well.

NOTE: The block size value is shared by all the filesystem functions
accessing target media for given file descriptor!
See 'Improving I/O performance' section of 'Maximizing Execution Speed' documentation page
for more details.
children.name: FATFS_VFS_FSTAT_BLKSIZE
children.title: Default block size

children.help:

https://github.com/FreeRTOS/FreeRTOS-Kernel/tree/smp

IDF has added an experimental port of this SMP kernel located in
